title: A man sells two cows for Rs 18,000. The cost price of both cows, is the same. The first cow is sold at a loss of 20% and the second at a gain of 25%. What is the total loss or gain in the entire process? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cost Price of the cow if there is a loss of 20% = ₹ 18000/(100–20) x100= ₹ 22500Cost Price of the cow if there is a gain of 25%= ₹18000/(100+25) x100= ₹14400Cost Price of TWO cows =₹ 22500 + 14400= ₹ 36900Sale Price of TWO cows = ₹ 2 x18000 =₹ 36000Loss= ₹ 36900–36000= ₹ 900So loss%= (C.P- S.P)/C.P x 100=(36900–36000)/36900 x 100= 900 x100/36900= 2.439%

Let the CP of each cow be 100 First cow sold at a loss of 20% . So it is sold for 80 2nd cow sold for 25% profit . So SP is 125 205 = 18000 Therefore 200 = 200×18000÷205 CP = 17561 approx. Profit= 439 Profit %= 439/17561 ×100= 0.025%
